title: Renishaw Hall Walking Route

images.title: Peter Barr / Renishaw Hall; courtyard, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Renishaw Hall courtyard. Contains a cafe and shop, and a museum devoted to the Sitwell trio, as well as to a number of businesses.

images.title: SMJ / Old Stables at Renishaw Hall, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Old Stables at Renishaw Hall

images.title: Peter Barr / Renishaw Hall, east wing, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Renishaw Hall, east wing

images.title: Ken Crosby / Middle Lawn & Fountain in Renishaw Hall Gardens, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Middle Lawn and Fountain in Renishaw Hall Gardens

images.title: Chris Allen / Renishaw Estate Sawmill
images.caption: Sawmill. The semi-portable steam engine before its removal and renovation. The vertical boiler appears to be an addition and implies failure of the semi-portable's boiler. The engine has been removed, renovated and is now on indoor display.

images.title: Classical Temple by Tony Bacon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Classical Temple

description: This country house near Sheffield is surrounded by attractive parkland and gardens. The main feature is the lovely Renishaw lake which has nice footpaths along the water and through the surrounding woodland. It's a lovely place for a stroll with wide grassy paths, shady woods and the River Rother running past the lake. Next to the hall there is a splendid 19th century Italianate garden with statues, beautiful flower arrangements and a fountain. At the time of writing the gardens are open Wednesday to Sunday and on Bank Holiday Mondays, 10.30am to 4.30pm during the season. Please check the link below for more details though. The Trans Pennine Trail and the Cuckoo Way both run right past the park so you could pick up one of these trails to extend your walk. If you were to head north you would come to the lovely Rother Valley Country Park where there are more walking trails around the large lakes.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Eckington Walk starts in the nearby town. It follows the Trans Pennine Trail to Rother Valley Lake. The route includes a disused section of the Chesterfield Canal. For more walking ideas in the area see the Derbyshire Walks page.
